IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The John Cooper School is an independent, co-educational primary and secondary school located in The Woodlands, TX. Enrollment during the 2017 tax year included approximately 1,242 students in grades Pre-kindergarten through twelfth.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The mission of The John Cooper School is to provide a challenging education in a caring environment to a diverse group of select students, enabling them to become creative thinkers, responsible citizens and leaders, and lifetime learners.
IRS990.Desc: The John Cooper School is an independent, co-educational primary and secondary school located in The Woodlands, TX. Enrollment during the 2017 tax year included approximately 1,242 students in grades Pre-kindergarten through twelfth. Financial aid is awarded to students on the basis of need.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: The John Cooper School is classified as a School under IRC Section 170(b)(1)(A)(ii). As such, it is not required to complete the Schedule A Part II Support Schedule for Organizations Described in Sections 170(b)(1)(A)(vi). The School is voluntarily including Schedule A Part II. For Schedule B Schedule of Contributors, the School meets the 33 1/3% support test of the regulations under sections 509(a)(1) and 170(b)(1)(A)(vi) and is reporting under the Special Rule.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part IV, Line 2b: Explanation of escrow account liability
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School holds funds for several related school groups. The School has limited discretion over the use of these funds. Funds held for others are included in the Schools cash and as a liability of the School.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Endowment funds are used for the enrichment of educational programs and operational activities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part XI, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Part XII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The school's nondiscrimination policy is contained on each application and enrollment contract as well as in the informational brochures made available to the public. Additionally, notice of the policy is published annually in the Houston Chronicle.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The John Cooper School awards scholarships each year based on the demonstrated financial need of the family regardless of race, color, nationality, or ethnic origin. These scholarship awards do not require repayment. The scholarship committee relies on the School Scholarship Service of Princeton, New Jersey to determine which families qualify for scholarship aid.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Mike Maher's compensation includes a housing allowance of $18,000 per year and a car allowance of $9,600 a year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 7: Non-Fixed payments not listed above
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Ms. DeMonico oversees extracurricular camps for dance and gymnastics. She receives additional compensation based on the revenue generated by the camps.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 1a: Explanation of Delegated Broad Authority to Committee
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Executive Committee of the Board is made up of the Officers of the Board: Chair, Vice-Chair, Treasurer & Secretary. Committee has all authority of the Board to manage the business & affairs of the School between Board meetings, except where action of the Board is required by law, Articles of Incorporation or current Bylaws. All actions of the Executive committee are subject to ratification of the full Board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form is reviewed in detail by the CFO. A copy of the Form 990 is provided to each Board member prior to filing. Any questions the Board may have in regards to the Form are addressed prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A conflict of interest / relationship questionnaire is provided to each board member annually for disclosure purposes. Each individual is reminded of the policy on a regular basis and their adherence is informally monitored.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A compensation committee consisting of board members reviews and recommends the annual compensation for the Head of School which is then approved by the entire Board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation data is obtained and analyzed from comparable schools and used extensively along with performance reviews.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Documents are available for review upon request. As such documents are not required to be made publicly available, each request is reviewed and either approved or denied on an individual basis.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other Changes In Net Assets Or Fund Balances - Other Increases
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Change in value of derivative agreement = $523013
